Home > SkyBridge® Instant Remoting

SkyBridge® Instant Remoting

Two computers are a world apart, separated by the Internet and firewalls. Using SkyBridge® instant remoting, in three lines of code , computer A can send an arbitrary byte array to B, B can send a response byte array back, the round trip happens within half a second. No learning curve is needed.

Since any complex data can be serialized into a byte array, two computers can use this API to implement any complex communication. The sky is the limit.

Behind the scenes, it is the SkyBridge® server which relays the data between the two computers

Every connection between a computer and the SkyBridge® server is uniquely encrypted using TLS. The server does not understand, store or log the data being relayed. The server has multiple instances in a auto-scaling group behind a load balancer in Amazon Web Services. If an instance crashes or all are stressed, more instances will be automatically launched to share the load.
